ygData.msgSnippet: Could be related to an issue we discovered with heritrix and bytes counts in the crawl.log not including HTTP response headers size. For that same reason we

Could be related to an issue we discovered with heritrix and bytes counts i=
n the crawl.log not including HTTP response headers size. For that same rea=
son we chose to write the extact byte size of each object in the crawl.log =
comment field to be absolutely sure about the accurate size when at the sam=
e time using the QuotaEnforcer module in heritrix.

Maybe you should use th=
e byte size recorded in the crawl.log comment field instead (should be a si=
mple change in the perl script) since you have been writing your crawl.logs=
 with NetarchiveSuite

best
Bjarne Andersen
Netarchive.dk
_________________=

Hello Noah,

We've b=
een working on updating the Perl script and still miss one thing:
how does =
Heritrix compile the bytes size? Does it use any filter?
Bytes count is sli=
ghtly different in reports produced by the Perl script
and Heritrix.

For i=
nstance:
* Total Raw Data Size in Bytes in a crawl-report.txt
produced by t=
he Perl script is: 69707545789 (64.92 GB)
produced by Heritrix is: 70005021=
208 (65 GB)

* bytes count a hosts-report.txt
produced by the Perl script i=
s: 999 21087897 www.apci.asso.fr 0 0
produced by Heritrix is: 999 21429018 =
www.apci.asso.fr 0 0

* bytes count a mimetype-report.txt
produced by the P=
erl script is: 114255 902098368 image/gif
produced by Heritrix is: 114255 9=
33750505 image/gif

But it can also be more in the count produced by the Pe=
rl script:
* Total Raw Data Size in Bytes in another crawl-report.txt
produ=
ced by the Perl script is: Total Raw Data Size in Bytes: 10980717146
(10.23=
 GB)
produced by Heritrix is: Total Raw Data Size in Bytes: 11080309933 (10=
 GB)

Thanks for your help!

Sara

Attachment]

[Attachment(s) from Noah Levitt inclu=
ded below]
Hello Sara,

I'm attaching another version of make_reports.pl. T=
his is the one we use
to clean up interrupted crawls for archive-it.org. (I=
 didn't know about
the one in the heritrix source tree until I saw this thr=
ead.)

I don't think this version will solve your problems, but maybe it wi=
ll
have something useful to you. For one thing it does create the [#robots]=

and [#remaining] columns in hosts-report.txt.

For our purposes, we don't =
need the output of the script to match heritrix
exactly. Your best bet migh=
t be to debug and edit the script yourself,
which I don't imagine should be=
 too difficult.

Noah
